title: Small Grants - Coding Projects for the Nordic Region (Code4Europe Grant)
eligibility_criteria: Alignment with the goals and priorities of the European Code Week
Focus on strengthening the digital skills of young people, especially girls
Project should have an educational digital/coding focus
Applicants must submit a clear proposal indicating use of funds

title: Code4Europe - empowering the new generation of Young Digital Europeans
eligibility_criteria: Projects must demonstrate significant impact in promoting programming, computational thinking, or digital skills.
Eligible applicants are organizations (including but not limited to NGOs, companies, schools) across EU.
Projects should target young people, especially girls.
Activities must be relevant to CodeWeek priorities and have educational impact.
Scalability and replicability of the project are assessed.

title: Second call for innovation studies for the development of generative AI models
eligibility_criteria: Consortium led by an SME or startup; up to two supporting participants/partners (max 3 partners total)

Main participant must be legally established in an EU Member State, eligible EEA country, or a country associated to the Digital Europe Programme with an association agreement in force before the deadline
Only legal entities (no individuals/natural persons) are eligible
SMEs may participate in only one of the FFplus subproject types (business experiments OR innovation studies)
Project focus: development/customization of generative AI models leveraging HPC
Demonstrate technical/business competence in AI, ML, software development, and access to suitable data
Reporting on adherence to EU guidelines for trustworthy AI is required
Maximum of 10 months duration per funded innovation study

title: ROMANIA INVESTMENT PARTNERS | Venture Capital
eligibility_criteria: Romanian legal entities (SRL or SA)
Privately owned (Romanian or foreign capital accepted)
Company incorporated in Romania (but activity may take place abroad)
Any CAEN/industry legal in Romania is eligible; no exclusions
Company must meet at least ONE: 2M€ operational revenue (last 2-3 years), 0.5M€ EBITDA, or 3M€ assets
Minimum financing requested: 3M€

title: EIC Accelerator
eligibility_criteria: Startup, SME or individual willing to launch an SME
Companies with up to 499 employees (mid-cap for investment only)
Based in EU Member State or Horizon Europe-associated country
Innovation at TRL 6-8 (technology demonstration to system complete)
Ambition to scale-up, high-risk for private investment
Applicants from third countries may relocate to an eligible country prior to full application
Applicants from the UK can apply for 'grant only'
Female CEOs particularly encouraged
